text: Ferdinan Backer "Nancy" Stevenson (June 8, 1928 – May 31, 2001) was an American politician who served as Lieutenant Governor of South Carolina from 1979 to 1983. She was the first and only woman to be elected to statewide office in South Carolina until the election of Dr. Barbara Nielsen as Superintendent of Education in 1990. She previously served two terms in the South Carolina House of Representatives and, after leaving office, unsuccessfully ran for the state's 2nd congressional district seat in 1984 against incumbent Floyd Spence. ==See also== *List of female lieutenant governors in the United States ==References== ==External links== * Category:1928 births Category:2001 deaths Category:20th-century American politicians Category:Smith College alumni Category:Women state legislators in South Carolina Category:Members of the South Carolina House of Representatives Category:Lieutenant Governors of South Carolina Category:Politicians from Charleston, South Carolina Category:Politicians from New Rochelle, New York Category:South Carolina Democrats Category:20th-century American women politicians Category:Candidates in the 1984 United States elections
